verses.verse: Then it happened <S%H1961><s%> in the spring, <S%H8666><s%> at the time <S%H6256><s%> when kings <S%H4428><s%> go <S%H3318><s%> out [to battle,] that Joab <S%H3097><s%> led <S%H5090><s%> out the army <S%H6635><s%> <S%H2428><s%> and ravaged <S%H7843><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon, <S%H5983><s%> and came <S%H935><s%> and besieged <S%H6696><s%> Rabbah. <S%H7237><s%> But David <S%H1732><s%> stayed <S%H3427><s%> at Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%> And Joab <S%H3097><s%> struck <S%H5221><s%> Rabbah <S%H7237><s%> and overthrew <S%H2040><s%> it.

And David <S%H1732><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> the crown <S%H5850><s%> of their king <S%H4428><s%> from his head, <S%H7218><s%> and he found <S%H4672><s%> it to weigh <S%H4948><s%> a talent <S%H3603><s%> of gold, <S%H2091><s%> and there was a precious <S%H3368><s%> stone <S%H68><s%> in it; and it was placed <S%H1961><s%> on David's head. <S%H7218><s%> And he brought <S%H3318><s%> out the spoil <S%H7998><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> a very <S%H3966><s%> great <S%H7235><s%> amount.

And he brought <S%H3318><s%> out the people <S%H5971><s%> who <S%H834><s%> [were] in it, and cut <S%H7787><s%> [them] with saws <S%H4050><s%> and with sharp <S%H2757><s%> instruments <S%H2757><s%> and with axes. <S%H4050><s%> And thus <S%H3651><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> to all <S%H3605><s%> the cities <S%H5892><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Ammon. <S%H5983><s%> Then David <S%H1732><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the people <S%H5971><s%> returned <S%H7725><s%> [to] Jerusalem. <S%H3389><s%>

Now it came <S%H1961><s%> about after <S%H310><s%> this, <S%H3651><s%> that war <S%H4421><s%> broke <S%H5975><s%> out at Gezer <S%H1507><s%> with the Philistines; <S%H6430><s%> then <S%H227><s%> Sibbecai <S%H5444><s%> the Hushathite <S%H2843><s%> killed <S%H5221><s%> Sippai, <S%H5598><s%> one of the descendants <S%H3211><s%> of the giants, <S%H9571><s%> and they were subdued. <S%H3665><s%>

And there was war <S%H4421><s%> with the Philistines <S%H6430><s%> again, <S%H5750><s%> and Elhanan <S%H445><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Jair <S%H3265><s%> killed <S%H5221><s%> Lahmi <S%H3902><s%> the brother <S%H251><s%> of Goliath <S%H1555><s%> the Gittite, <S%H1663><s%> the shaft <S%H6086><s%> of whose spear <S%H2595><s%> [was] like a weaver's beam. <S%H4500><s%>

And again <S%H5750><s%> there was war <S%H4421><s%> at Gath, <S%H1661><s%> where there was a man <S%H376><s%> of [great] stature <S%H4060><s%> who had twenty-four fingers <S%H676><s%> and toes, <S%H676><s%> six <S%H8337><s%> [fingers on each hand] and six <S%H8337><s%> [toes on each foot;] and he also <S%H1571><s%> was descended <S%H3205><s%> from the giants. <S%H9571><s%>
And when he taunted <S%H2778><s%> Israel, <S%H3478><s%> Jonathan <S%H3083><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Shimea, <S%H8092><s%> David's brother, <S%H251><s%> killed <S%H5221><s%> him.

These <S%H411><s%> were descended <S%H3205><s%> from the giants <S%H9571><s%> in Gath, <S%H1661><s%> and they fell <S%H5307><s%> by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of David <S%H1732><s%> and by the hand <S%H3027><s%> of his servants. <S%H5650><s%>
